description: From Ancient Greek ἴσος (ísos, “equal”) + Ancient Greek χρόνος (khrónos, “time”)  +‎ -ous.

entries.meaning: Happening at the same time; simultaneous.
(computing) Of or pertaining to the use of clocks derived from the same clock reference.
examples: Their entire national telephone network is isochronous, with a clock distribution tree radiating from a single, protected cesium reference clock.

entries.meaning: (computing) of or pertaining to data associated with time-sensitive applications.
examples: These packets belong to an isochronous voice application and need priority handling.
